# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String, text_width::Int=10)
    lines = split(s, ' ')
    wrapped_lines = []
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in lines
        if length(current_line)*text_width + length(word) > text_width*2  # to account for spaces
            push!(wrapped_lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        elseif isempty(current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= " " * word
        end
    end
    
    if !isempty(current_line)  # append remaining words
        push!(wrapped_lines, current_line)
    end
    
    return wrapped_lines
end
```

Here is an example:

```julia
s = "This is a very long string that needs to be wrapped properly so it doesn't exceed the specified text width."
result = wrap_string(s, 10)
println("Original String:\n$s\n\nWrapped Lines:\n$(join(result, "\n"))")
```
